High_Point.Richard Mendenhall Plantation Buildings: Richard Mendenhall Plantation Buildings is a historic plantation house and plantation complex located at Jamestown, Guilford County, North Carolina. The Mendenhall farmhouse was built in 1811, and consists of a two-story, brick main block of plain typically Quaker design, with a porch on three sides and a number of additions to the west and rear. Also on the property is a large early barn of the Pennsylvania German type and a well house.
